docs.lead_paragraph: The swine flu is in 41 states, and flulike illnesses account for 6.1 percent of doctor visits, health officials said.

headline.main: Officials See a Shortage in Vaccine for Swine Flu
headline.print_headline: Officials See A Shortage In Vaccine For Swine Flu

docs.snippet: The swine flu is in 41 states, and flulike illnesses account for 6.1 percent of doctor visits, health officials said.

docs.lead_paragraph: Health officials on Friday predicted a shortfall in the supply of swine flu vaccine, as the numbers of cases, hospitalizations and deaths grow to levels unprecedented for this time of year. Flu caused by the H1N1 virus is now widespread in 41 states, and flulike illnesses account for 6.1 percent of all doctor visits.

headline.main: Officials See A Shortage In Vaccine For Swine Flu

docs.abstract: Health officials predict shortfall in supply of swine flu vaccine, as numbers of cases, hospitalizations and deaths grow to levels unprecedented for this time of year; flu caused by H1N1 virus is widespread in 41 states; 43 children have died from swine flu since Aug 30--about same number that usually die in entire flu season (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: People who do not believe in vaccinating children have found fuel for their arguments in the swine flu vaccine.
